column4: hello, I'm trying to setup dual monitors under ubuntu.  Everything this working except when i move my mouse to the second monitor i cannot move it back to the first monitor.  Any ideas?
ubuntu verision? video card type ? video card drivers (where you got them from) ?
9.10amd64, Quadro FX 2700M, nvidia 195 beta driver (i've tried the stable one as well) and got from nvidia's site
ok i assume you are using the nvidia control panel >?
i've used it and have hand edited xorg.conf as well
you shouldn't need to touch xorg. but describe how you attempted to setup the dual screen with the control panel
well the reason i had to hand edit it was because the second screen i'm using is a vertical monitor attached to a laptop, and TwinView won't let you rotate a single monitor
i enabled Xinerama and configured the resolutions of both monitors and then added the rotate option to xorg.conf so it would be the proper direction
so then you are using two separate x sessions per screen ?
ok xinerama not 2 x sessions.
yea
everything works fine except that when i move the mouse over to the second screen it won't move back to the first monitor
and this gets both screens working and the vertical one rotated? (but you cant treat them like one coherent display)
I can one way.  I can move windows to the second monitor but cannot move them back to the first

ah ok one thing i can think of is that the way multi screens work in twinview and xinerama is that the mouse leave s one screen via a porthole and enters the next screen through any of its sides (not a porthole)... maybe the destination screen porthole is not where you expect it to be (on the adjacent side of you first monitor)
so perhaps try to move the cursor past all eges of the second screen.
tried that
yes it was too easy to be the solution.
did you by chance read/find this : http://linux.derkeiler.com/Mailing-Lists/Ubuntu/2008-10/msg01251.html
the really weird part is that i can move the windows back and forth but not the mouse
mouse refuses to leave 2nd monitor ?
